tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensors_usage_history (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experiment_id INT,
    usage_date DATE,
    usage_time TIME,
    measurement_value FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE quantum_sensors (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  experiment_id INT NOT NULL,
  usage_date DATE,
  PRIMARY KEY (sensor_id, experiment_id)
)

CREATE TABLE experiments (
  experiment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  experiment_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  researcher_id INT NOT NULL,
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE,
  CONSTRAINT fk_researcher_id FOREIGN KEY (researcher_id) REFERENCES researchers(researcher_id)
)

CREATE TABLE researchers (
  researcher_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  researcher_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_usage (
	sensor_id INT,
	experiment_id INT,
	usage_date DATE,
	usage_duration INT,
	FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES quantum_sensors(sensor_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (experiment_id) REFERENCES experiments(experiment_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_usage (
  usage_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT REFERENCES sensor(sensor_id),
  experiment_id INT REFERENCES experiment(experiment_id),
  usage_date DATE,
  usage_duration INTERVAL
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
  data_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT REFERENCES sensor(sensor_id),
  experiment_id INT REFERENCES experiment(experiment_id),
  data_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  data_value FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_usage (
    usage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    experiment_id INT,
    usage_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor(sensor_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (experiment_id) REFERENCES experiment(experiment_id)
);

CREATE TABLE experiment_results (
    result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    experiment_id INT,
    result_description TEXT,
    result_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (experiment_id) REFERENCES experiment(experiment_id)
);
